page.title: 08CLOWNE MARKET
page.content: CLOWNE MARKET WAS OPENED IN SUMMER 1983.IT IS HELD ON THURSDAYS IN AN AREA NORMALLY USED FOR CAR PARKING JUST BEHIND THE MAIN STREET. TRADERS ARE LICENSED BY BOLSOVER DISTRICT COUNCIL.THE RENT FOR A 3 METRE STALL IS Â£3.50 BETWEEN JANUARY AND MARCH RISING TO Â£5.50 FOR THE REST OF THE YEAR. ON THE DAY OF OUR SURVEY;MAY 23RD; THERE WERE 36 STALLS.THE STALLHOLDERS ORIGINATED FROM A VARIETY OF PLACES. THE FURTHEST COMING FROM GRIMSBY. OTHERS TRAVELLING QUITE LONG DISTANCES COMING FROM PLACES SUCH AS LEEDS, NOTTINGHAM,DONCASTER,MELBOURNE AND AMBERGATE.MANSFIELD,6,AND BOLSOVER,4, BEING THE TWO MOST COMMON PLACES OF ORIGIN. IN TERMS OF PRODUCTS FOR SALE CLOTHING WITH 11 STALLS AND FOOD WITH 10 STALLS WERE THE MOST POPULAR.
